pyfea.fea.geometry¶

Tetrahedron¶

Base geometry, mainly for easy data output, more efficient data structures are used when calculating.

class pyfea.fea.geometry.Tetrahedron(points, pointcloud, entity_mesh=None, array_num=None)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

get_neighbors(tets=None)¶

Find neighboring tets

refine_mesh(point=None, function=<function Tetrahedron.<lambda>>)¶

Splits the tetrahedron x-times with a specified function for spacing around the specified point.

array_num = None¶
entity_mesh = None¶
neighbors = None¶
pointcloud = None¶
points = array([None, None, None, None], dtype=object)¶

EntityMesh¶

Geometry definition class for tet meshes, groups tetrahedrons and the pointcloud matrix.

class pyfea.fea.geometry.EntityMesh(surface_mesh=None)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

creates an entitymesh from a surface mesh (STL-like) also creates an STL temp file (could be useful later on)

SurfaceMesh¶

Geometry definition class for surface meshes, groups triangles and the pointcloud matrix.

class pyfea.fea.geometry.SurfaceMesh(points=None, tri=None, filename=None)¶

Part¶

Uses EntityMesh as a base, defines additional part information such as materials.

class pyfea.fea.geometry.Part(material=None, **kwargs)¶

Extends the EntityMesh class to include part properties such as materials.

__init__(material=None, **kwargs)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

material = None¶
name = None¶

Assembly¶

Uses EntityMesh as a base, groups multiple parts in an assembly.

class pyfea.fea.geometry.Assembly(parts, auto_unify_mesh=True, **kwargs)¶

Is used to compile multiple Part instances to calculate interactions

__init__(parts, auto_unify_mesh=True, **kwargs)¶
